lines.text: Not much meat on her, but what's there is 'cherce'.
[Last lines]
What would happen if I ever dropped you?
I'd go right down the drain.
And?
I'd take you right down with me shorty.
I'll show her.
Who?
Myself, that's who.
I don't think you've ever been properly handled.
That's right... not even by myself.
Maybe we ought to wait until I don't feel so... so carved up, so nobody.
Why don't you just let me take charge?

[softly]
I have to be in charge of myself.
Oh, what's the good of this? I mean, after all...
Have to have time to think it over is all.
Well, just see that you don't think it under. It's a nice long ride, just take your time.

[gets up and starts throwing her baggage out the window of the train]
That's right! And I'm not going to take it!

[to Collier]
I've got to do something to prove to you, prove to myself - lend me some money will you - prove to both of us, in fact, everybody that I'm not just a...
[rushes from the train car]
What do you weigh this morning?
Why up 2? Did you eat extra?
No, no, honest.
Let him talk himself, will ya?
[looks at Hucko]
No, no, honest.

That's all, honey, that's all, say no more. Of course there's always a chance you could be an escaped fruitcake. But if there is something in what... as a matter of fact, if there is anything in what you say, I am going to promote you into the King of the World! Queen, I mean. Let's go.

[bouncing tennis balls with her racket]
Would you like to see me serve a few, Mr. Conovan?
Oh, no, no, just hit a couple.

Like I told you - don't feel like running, slow down. You're supposed to feel like it. That shows you're in condition. People do like they feel, they go on sometimes practically forever, some of them.
Guess you'll go on practically forever, you stay on that bike.
It was Collier. Never can do anything when he's watching me, it's always been that way.
Why?
In love with him I guess.
Oh. Like me with lobster.
What?
Lobster... the one thing I'm nuts about. The one thing that don't agree with me. Like you and him.
Well, not exactly.
Why?
Well, you see, this is a question of getting married. You've never been married to a lobster.
Ha ha ha ha ha. That's what you think.

[suspicious]
Have another beer?

[inanely]
No thanks, no more.

[hollers at Gibby]
You see that?
Davie, what're you doin' to me?
Nervous, thirsty!
Water, did you ever hear of water?
[Hucko nods, grinning]
Well, why didn't you drink water?
Um, ashamed.
You're what?
Nervous, thirsty- I go in the place, I'm ashamed to ask for free water! Took one beer.
Aww.
Yeah.
[hangs head]
Uh-huh. Did you like it?

[chuckles]
Yeah!
What?
No!
What's to prevent me smoking when you're not around?
When am I not around?
Well, you don't expect to be watching me every minute... out of every... twenty-four hours... out of every day, do you?
If I have to, sure.
Not sure I'll like that.

Not asking you to like it. But you'll see pretty soon, pretty soon I'll trust you because you'll trust me. Because what's good for you is good for me and you for me, see? We're the same. We're equal. We're partners, see? 5-0, 5-0.

[to Mrs. Beminger at the golf course]
You know what you can do with your gluteal muscle? Give it away for Christmas!
Mrs. Beminger, if you could possibly lift the needle from that long playing phonograph you keep in your face...
[forcing Mrs. Beminger into a chair, twice]
Watch this...
[to a fellow golfer]
Will you excuse me?
[drives nine golf balls in succession]

[to Mrs. Beminger]
You know what you can do with your gluteal muscle? Give it away for Christmas!
